timeline.message: temporary enable docstore validation at startup.

timeline.bodyText:
Note that this will not work properly if gid calculatiation change or document id corruption caused the validation to fail.
This is due to document meta store having the gid based upon original gid calculation with original document id, while this remove uses new gid calculation with a possibly corrupted document id.
The original validation used a batch remove feed operation that had a vector of lids to remove. I believe that operation needs to be resurrected too in some form.
timeline.author: toregge

replies.bodyText:
Hmm, I will look back in history and see if that is easily resurrected then.
You also had another comment on #2576. Is that still valid ?
replies.author: baldersheim

timeline.message: Make RemoveOperation an interface and move implmentation to RemoveOperationWithDocId
First take at making a gid based remove.

timeline.bodyText: Old lid already exists in grandparent class, c.f. getPrevLid() method.

timeline.bodyText: putMetaData should not be called for RemoveOperationWithGid. But this should be implicitly enforced by the operation always having 0 (i.e. invalid) as the new lid.
timeline.author: toregge

timeline.bodyText: The expression for this if should never evaluate to true.
timeline.author: toregge

timeline.bodyText: We don't want new entries in the removed sub db if rmOp is a RemoveOperationWithGid. In that case, setDbDocumentId() should not be called.
timeline.author: toregge

timeline.bodyText: Pleas add an assert(!getValidDbdId());, to ensure that we're not serializing a bad RemoveOperationWithGid.
timeline.author: toregge

timeline.message: Remove LID and add an assert before serializing.

timeline.bodyText: Please extend unit test to also test (de)serialize of RemoveOperationWithGid.
timeline.author: toregge
